Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Pastor Malobe Sampson, Thessalonia Baptist Church, 951 Reverend James A. Polite Avenue, Bronx, N.Y. 10459.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Salamanca.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Pastor Malobe Simpson, Thessalonia Baptist Church, 951 Reverend James A. Polite Avenue, The Bronx, N.Y. 10459.

Council Member Salamanca moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 28, 2016 be adopted as printed by Council Member Ferreras-Copeland.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Fereras-Copeland moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of September 28, 2016 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Kenneth Mitchell to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his appointment to the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 2301 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Kenneth Mitchell, Taxi and Limousine Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Transmitting proposed maritime lease ("Lease") between the City of New York ("City‚Äù), acting by and through its Department of Small Business Services, as landlord ("Landlord") and Ferrara Bros. LLC, as tenant ("Tenant"), initially for approximately 58,000 square foot City-owned parcel located on the waterfront and along 3rd Avenue in Sunset Park, Brooklyn ("Moore McCormack Site"), pursuant to City Charter Section 1301(2)(f).
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, FERRARA BROS. LLC MARITIME LEASE, Brooklyn (20175115 PNK)

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application nos. C 160310 ZSM, C 160311 ZSM, C 160312 ZSM, and C 160313 ZSM shall be subject to Council review. These items are related to application nos. N 160308 ZRM and C 160309 ZMM, which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Special Hudson River Park District, Manhattan (C160310ZSM, C160311ZSM, C160312ZSM, C160313ZSM, N160308ZRM and C160309ZMM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application nos. C 160338 ZSM and C 160339 ZSM shall be subject to Council review. These items are related to application nos. C 160336 ZMM, N 160337 ZRM and C 160340 HAM which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, Park Ave, East 108th St, Lexington Ave & East 107th St, Manhattan (C160338ZSM, C160339ZSM, C160336ZMM, N160337ZRM and C160340HAM)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, Briana‚Äôs Law, requiring all police officers to be retrained in cardiopulmonary resuscitation every two years.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Briana‚Äôs Law (A.4364-A/S.6717)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption for rent increases granted to certain senior citizens.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOB to report on the efficacy of outdoor reset controls.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign legislation that would increase the amount of housing subsidy from $300 to $600 per month, and extend the age eligibility from 21 to 24 for youth who have aged out of foster care
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Increase the amount of housing subsidy from $300 to $600 per month, and to extend the age eligibility from 21 to 24 for youth who have aged out of foster care.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring assistance if requested for individuals signing up to be organ donors as part of the agency-based voter registration program
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring assistance if requested for individuals signing up to be organ donors as part of the agency-based voter registration program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign into law, A.9108 and S.6452-A, which would amend the election law to consolidate New York‚Äôs federal, state, and local primaries into one primary which would take place on the fourth Tuesday of June.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally noted his opposition to the passage of this item:
Council Member Matteo.

The following 2 Council Members formally noted their abstention on this item:  
Council Members Gentile and Greenfield.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Consolidate NY‚Äôs federal, state, and local primaries into one primary which would take place on the fourth Tuesday of June. (A.9108 and S.6452-A)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Mayor of the City of New York to create an annual Student Voter Registration Day.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Create an annual Student Voter Registration Day.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A2529/S857, allowing 16 and 17 year-olds to pre-register to vote.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 2 Council Members formally noted their opposition to the passage of this item:  
Council Members Borelli and Matteo.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Allowing 16 and 17 year-olds to pre-register to vote. (A2529/S857)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.7634, which would amend both the New York State Election Law and the Correction Law, in relation to voting by convicted felons.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 3 Council Members formally noted their opposition to the passage of this item: 
Council Members Borelli, Grodenchik, and Matteo.

The following Council Member formally noted his abstention on this item: 
Council Member Gentile.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Voting by convicted felons. (A.7634)

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, November 16, 2016.

MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Public Advocate (Ms. James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Villa Gardens, Block 3321, Lot 38; Bronx, Community District No. 7, Council District No. 11
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 464-A, 50-1-0 (Negative: CM Matteo);
LU No. 493 & Res. No. 1266, 50-0-1 (CM Barron).

See files for individual votes.
At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared that the aforementioned items were adopted and referred to the Committee on Land Use and to the appropriate Land Use Subcommittee.
